agency_impact: The University of Hawai'i (UH) confirms the proposed fund structure is similar to other existing UH funds, now including the Student Activities Revolving Fund as an example alongside previously mentioned funds (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-21-25_). This structure aims to standardize conference center programs and facilitate administration across all campuses and operating units (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-21-25_). The measure is intended to eliminate unnecessary duplication of statutes (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-21-25_).
policy_impact: The measure has advanced legislatively, as the Committee on Finance is now in accord with the intent and purpose of the bill and recommends that it pass Third Reading (HB1169_HD1_HSCR862_). This indicates progress beyond the earlier stage where amendments may have been made to encourage further discussion. The University of Hawai'i System has reiterated its support for the measure in testimony before the finance committee (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-21-25_).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the measure's legislative advancement; the House Committee on Finance now recommends the bill pass Third Reading, signaling progress from a previous version that may have included a placeholder effective date to encourage discussion (HB1169_HD1_HSCR862_). The University of Hawai'i System provided new testimony reiterating its support and adding the Student Activities Revolving Fund as another example of a similarly structured fund, which supports the goal of standardizing administration (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-21-25_). No new financial data or appropriations have been introduced.
